page.title: 15LOWESTOFT CHILDREN'S PETS
page.content: In Whitton Green Primary School 128 children have got pets and 39 have no pets. Altogether there are 75 dogs,325 fish, 58 cats, 43 rabbits, 21 budgies, 11 hamsters, 14 gerbils, 14 tortoises, 6 horses, 17 mice, 62 pigeons and 2 guinea pigs all kept as pets. I have a gentle chestnut-coloured horse called Tilly. She is 14.2 hands high and has a white blaze down her nose. She eats bran and hay and drinks water. My cat, Mizzy, has black and white fur and drinks milk. She will not chase birds but will scratch you if teased. Flash, my tortoise, is 34 years old. It has scales on its head, tail and legs. Its shell is dark green. It eats fruit, lettuce and tomato. My alsatian dog called Ching is 11 years old. She is well trained & does not bark a lot. Ching likes dog biscuits & long walks.
